trans-unit.source: Accessing Azure Virtual Machines from Server Explorer
trans-unit.target: Accessing Azure Virtual Machines from Server Explorer

trans-unit.source: Get an overview of how to view create and manage Azure virtual machines (VMs) in Server Explorer in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Get an overview of how to view create and manage Azure virtual machines (VMs) in Server Explorer in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Accessing Azure Virtual Machines from Server Explorer
trans-unit.target: Accessing Azure Virtual Machines from Server Explorer

trans-unit.source: By using Server Explorer in Visual Studio, you can display information about your virtual machines hosted by Azure.
trans-unit.target: By using Server Explorer in Visual Studio, you can display information about your virtual machines hosted by Azure.

trans-unit.source: Accessing virtual machines in Server Explorer
trans-unit.target: Accessing virtual machines in Server Explorer

trans-unit.source: If you have virtual machines hosted by Azure, you can access them in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: If you have virtual machines hosted by Azure, you can access them in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: You must first sign in to your Azure subscription to view your mobile services.
trans-unit.target: You must first sign in to your Azure subscription to view your mobile services.

trans-unit.source: To sign in, open the shortcut menu for the Azure node in Server Explorer, and choose **Connect to Microsoft Azure**.
trans-unit.target: To sign in, open the shortcut menu for the Azure node in Server Explorer, and choose **Connect to Microsoft Azure**.

trans-unit.source: To get information about your virtual machines
trans-unit.target: To get information about your virtual machines

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, choose a virtual machine, and then choose the F4 key to show its properties window.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, choose a virtual machine, and then choose the F4 key to show its properties window.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows what properties are available, but they are all read-only.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows what properties are available, but they are all read-only.

trans-unit.source: To change them, use the management portal.
trans-unit.target: To change them, use the management portal.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: DNS Name
trans-unit.target: DNS Name

trans-unit.source: The URL with the Internet address of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The URL with the Internet address of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Environment
trans-unit.target: Environment

trans-unit.source: For a virtual machine, the value of this property is always Production.
trans-unit.target: For a virtual machine, the value of this property is always Production.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The name of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The name of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Size
trans-unit.target: Size

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine, which reflects the amount of memory and disk space that’s available.
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine, which reflects the amount of memory and disk space that’s available.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see How To: Configure Virtual Machine Sizes.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see How To: Configure Virtual Machine Sizes.

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Values include Starting, Started, Stopping, Stopped, and Retrieving Status.
trans-unit.target: Values include Starting, Started, Stopping, Stopped, and Retrieving Status.

trans-unit.source: If Retrieving Status appears, the current status is unknown.
trans-unit.target: If Retrieving Status appears, the current status is unknown.

trans-unit.source: The values for this property differ from the values that are used on the management portal.
trans-unit.target: The values for this property differ from the values that are used on the management portal.

trans-unit.source: SubscriptionID
trans-unit.target: SubscriptionID

trans-unit.source: The subscription ID for your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: The subscription ID for your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: You can show this information on the management portal by viewing the properties for a subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can show this information on the management portal by viewing the properties for a subscription.

trans-unit.source: Choose an endpoint node, and then view the **Properties** window.
trans-unit.target: Choose an endpoint node, and then view the **Properties** window.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the available properties of endpoints, but they are read-only.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the available properties of endpoints, but they are read-only.

trans-unit.source: To add or edit the endpoints for a virtual machine, use the management portal.
trans-unit.target: To add or edit the endpoints for a virtual machine, use the management portal.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: An identifier for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: An identifier for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Private Port
trans-unit.target: Private Port

trans-unit.source: The port for network access internal to your application.
trans-unit.target: The port for network access internal to your application.

trans-unit.source: Protocol
trans-unit.target: Protocol

trans-unit.source: The protocol that the transport layer for this endpoint uses, either TCP or UDP.
trans-unit.target: The protocol that the transport layer for this endpoint uses, either TCP or UDP.

trans-unit.source: Public Port
trans-unit.target: Public Port

trans-unit.source: The port that’s used for public access to your application.
trans-unit.target: The port that’s used for public access to your application.

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles
